Description: Canadian National Railway Company agreed to pay a civil penalty of $5.25 million to resolve an FCC Enforcement Bureau investigation into the company's acquisition and operation of hundreds of wireless radio facilities in the United States without prior FCC approval.

Private Litigation Case Title: Barnes v. Canadian Nat'l IL Central

Description: Illinois Central Railroad agreed to pay a $50,000 civil penalty to resolve claims that corn spilled after a 2002 derailment allegedly polluted a creek near its Clinton rail yard. The spill allegedly killed more than 7,800 fish.
Notes: In February 2004, Illinois Central paid $2,765.63 to the Illinois Department of Natural Resources (IDNR) in penalties for the estimated 7,800 fish killed as a result of the incident.

Description: Lunda Construction and Wisconsin Central agreed to pay a total of $150,000 to settle stream protection violations. The announcement did not specify how much each company would pay. Here we assume the total was divided evenly between them.

Description: The U.S. Department of Labor ordered two railroad companies to pay three workers a total of $650,729.14 in back wages and damages for retaliating against them for reporting workplace injuries and safety concerns.

The Occupational Safety and Health Administration found Wisconsin Central Limited railway in violation of the Federal Railroad Safety Act for terminating a conductor following the reporting of a workplace injury that occurred in Manitowoc, Wis.

TheOccupational Safety and Health Administration found Grand Trunk Western Railway Co. and Union Pacific Railroad Co. in violation of the Federal Railroad Safety Act for suspending and/or disciplining workers following the reporting of workplace injuries or illnesses.
